one_reviews_text: play countless hrs and never want to get off love this game

It's a great tower defense game, but it has no graphical settings and it is so darn blurry. Dear developer, please add graphical settings, because i have a massive gaming pc and i'd like to up the AA or resolution scale. It could've been greater.

review_title: Really fun but missing a lot.
one_reviews_text: So i started the campaign and had a blast for 8 hours til I beat it.  Then I was like i cant wait to play custom levels or endless wave mode...But this version of the game has neither.  Not even one map to go crazy map...just one big flat open map.  Why shoot yourself in the foot by only having the campaign mode

Really cool tower defense game.  Has lots of towers to choose from for strategies against enemies.  Action builds up to tons of effects going off at once.  Pretty wild.  It uses Touch controllers for building towers and pointing, works well.  I haven't had any problems with saving the game like some have.

review_title: 1 star is even to much for this crap

I Hope that is a great game, but I can not download it from the oculus shop. It drops on 50 mbs. Well I think It has to be refunded.
After several years this is still one of the best VR games you can find. I hope we can see a new game in the series.

review_title: It's still one of the best VR Game ever~
one_reviews_text: A great game that most players would love in dream VR! Now, it's getting more fun by playing using the new Oculus wireless Air Link (but not working using Virtual Desktop), no more cable linked to the PC. Love the whole immersion into the 3D VR world.  You wouldnt regreat. Highly recommended !

I loved the original and invested an insane amount of hours in it.  I really enjoy the gameplay in this one as well but... I can't save.  I researched online and tried every fix I could find including disabling OneDrive etc and nothing worked.  Refund requested.  :(

review_title: Would be a 5 but no saved games
one_reviews_text: I first bought this game when it was on sale for 1/2 price. I had the issue where even though I purchased the game, it would say it was the demo. I returned the game not knowing when or if this would be fixed. The developer said they fixed the issue so I bought it again at full price. Now I have the problem that the developer hasn't addressed; no saved games. After each level you should see an icon next to the level showing that it is complete. These show up, until I restart the game then all progress is lost. The odd thing is that all of the levels are unlocked.That wasn't true for the non-vr steam version. You had to unlock as you progressed. This game would easily be a 5 for me but the developer is not addressing the saved games issue. I played both DG 1 and DG 2 on Steam and loved both games. I was so hyped to see this here on the Oculus store on VR and I love the experience, but NO SAVED GAMES!! That mean no progress or weapon unlocks every time I restart the game. What gives? They developer need to address this issue. I bet a lot of people don't even realize they have this issue since they can get to every level. This is just dumb. Fix it already. It obviously this likely has to do with the location of the Documents folder in Windows and it probably fairly simple to fix. So frustrating. I love this game, but the bugs are inexcusable.

I love this game so much. The bugs seems to have been ironed out and I have played around 80% of the game. 
This is the best tower defence strategy game I have played, VR or pancake.

review_title: Bought the game, says it's the demo.
one_reviews_text: I read a similar review saying they bought the game, but the game says "you have finished playing the demo!" and to purchase the full game after level 3.  I also have this issue.  I bought the game, I really hope this is fixed soon before I refund.
review_feedback: Was told that Oculus fixed this today.  Please check your game and see if you have all the content now.

one_reviews_text:
It's same situation as the other people.
I can't play chapter 2 because of the demo message, despite the fact that I paid for it.  (Not in IAP, purchased in Oculus store).
Oculus support is helping me, but they haven't been able to solve the problem yet.
I like this game, so please fix it.

Updated: December 5, 2020
This problem has been solved, as the developer comments.
Thank you very much to all the developers and the Oculus Support team.
Now I can say that this game is the best VR tower defense game!
Especially for those who like to watch little things moving around in a miniature world, it's perfect for you.
review_feedback: Was told that Oculus fixed this today.  Please check your game and see if you have all the content now.

I have the same problem as other people here. I bought the full game and only got the demo. Please fix this.

Update 05.12.2020
Now everything works and I gladly give the game the deserved 5 stars. If you like tower defense and own a VR headset you should get this one.
review_feedback: Was told that Oculus fixed this today.  Please check your game and see if you have all the content now.

Update: 11/3/2020 - Still no resolution to my problem. Oculus support keeps saying its not their problem that the developer needs to fix it. No one from the developer has contacted me or followed up to fix the problem.Very disapointed and frustrated.


I purchased this game a while back and now it tells me I need to pay to play the full game. I contacted oculus support and they told me to contact the game developer. Great game but can’t enjoy it if I can’t only play the first 4 missions.
review_feedback: Oculus support is the one to help you - sorry that they didn't.  There was a time when the In app purchase was separate, but then it got included with the game.  For some reason it didn't download with the game for you (you did pay for it), and it should have.  I'll reach out to Oculus to see if they can help rectify this.

I am so surprised that despite so many bad reviews here, the developer did not address this bug in the app sale. Truely disappointing! I really hope this gets addressed soon. Will change the review to 5 star after this issue is fixed as the game in itself is really good.

review_title: would be a 5 if I could save
one_reviews_text: I'm enjoying this game so much that I'm going out of my way to try and figure out why it's not saving. The game creates a blank folder where the save should be but its, well, blank.... Others are having the same issue. Being able to save your progress is a big part of any game and seems like it would be an easy fix. I can 't understand for the life of me why this hasn't been fixed yet. Reached out to the dev via e-mail and Discord with no response.
Won't save and unable to get a refund!!

I really like the game. It's fun and addictive. But there is no progress saved. When I quit the game, all progress is lost. 
The game creates the profile file (in my documents), but theres no data in it. I read about the one drive issue, so I stopped syncing the documents file - it didnt't work. So this game is quite useless without saved progress  :-(

UPDATE: Everything works fine now. Best TD ever!!! Love it!
Really good game but the moment I log out all the progress is lost.  It's a real shame as the game is really addicting and translates to VR really well.

See this is an ongoing issue, but cannot find the solution.  Bought the game on sale and it only goes up to level 4.  Disappointing but an excellent port to VR of a brilliant game.
Hope there is a solution as I do not want to refund it.

Update - 16 January 2020

Oculus have been great, but...

The issue has now been repaired and has resulted in a "Game Files Corrupt" issue so it is now completely unplayable...

Update - 23 January 2020

Communication is now sparse.  No further replies for the developer and the same questions over and over again from different support people at oculus.

Reduced my initial rating from 5 stars down to 1.  Not a game rating, but this should not be so hard to fix...

Update 25 January 2020

Installed Oculus software and Defense Grid on a second machine.  Fresh installation of Windows 10 updated to Build 1909.  Different make and model of MB, CPU, RAM, SSD and GPU.  Oculs Rift S and Oculus Quest with Link.  Same error in that I get demo with full purchase.

Oculus says developer and developer says Oculus.  Tennis anyone?

To be fair, Oculus are slowly trying to help...
review_feedback: There appears to be an error in the packaging of the product by Oculus where you are only getting the demo when you should be getting BOTH the demo and the IAP package that gives you full access to the game.  Please contact Oculus support and have them grant you the IAP that is supposed to be INCLUDED whenever the game is sold at premium.

The details say that an Internet connection is not required.  This is false, unless you want to just play the demo part.  Every single time I want to play the later parts, I must take my computer from my house, which does not have Internet connectivity, and play at a house that does have it.  Every single time. I would like to give it five stars, but not with this problem.

I bought DG1 and DG2 on Steam and this one for Oculus Rift S. The game is great. Getting gold medal for every single map is quite challenging. 
One thing I would love to have is the ability to create your own level in the VR edition of DG2. 
Can you make this possible?
I wouldn't mind paying for a DLC level editor, and I guess others wouldn't mind either.
If you are a fan of tower defence games than this one is for you! Done really well with some ........... Interesting commentary from the in game characters. I would love to see more games like this.

This game is a classic and the VR version is wonderful. The problem is that there is the in app purchase. After buying the game, it says I got the first chapter free and then wants you to pay another $17 to unlock the rest. I contacted both Hidden Path and Oculus. Hidden Path responded within a day saying it was A problem with Oculus store. They would let them know. Great support from them... still haven’t heard from Oculus support. I have no idea if it has been fixed or not.
review_feedback: Was told that Oculus fixed this today.  Please check your game and see if you have all the content now.

one_reviews_text:
All the core gameplay is top-notch - the story missions are fun and engaging, with the different personalities being interesting to listen to as they chatter back and forth. Tons of challenge missions and good difficulty options to test your skill against, too.

Unlocking tower upgrades feels hit or miss, and the game doesn't make the best use of VR - I would have liked to see more direct interaction with the towers, such as picking them up and placing them.

Also, I have noticed this game tends to lock up on the headset every so often, voiding any progress in a mission, which is frustrating - so far, I've been unable to remedy the issue.

Despite the issue and the two small criticisms, this game is well worth your time and money.
I've played this for hours at a time,it's very addictive in vr,great job on enhancing an already perfect game!

review_title: Bought Game says i have free version

review_title: Best Tower Defense Game All Time
one_reviews_text: Hands down, this is the thing I’ve spent the most time playing in VR. There are challenge modes that increase replayability. There is even a fast forward function so the second and third and fourth time around you can spend less time on each level. Highly recommend this title!

review_title: Great game! a little glitchy, but love
one_reviews_text: Game is awesome, worth thte money. a little glitchy at times but not anything that cause concern. def recommend this!
Game is unplayable, it freeze like every 4-5 seconds and then it runs normaly for another 4-5 seconds until it freeze again. I check cpu usage and it runs fine, just 45% of load.

The game does not pull me in but once I start I play it for hours. It's a very safe and sound TD game, recommended for both novice and experts to the genre. The foundations are perfectly done here but the creativity lacks. Graphics are good on Nvidia 970; never got any issue on this. If you are looking for a challenge you'll find it  here. Unlike a lot of Oculus titles, this is a complete and full game here, if you like this game you can easily spend 40 hours in it.

Even though DG2 is not my usual cup of tea, it is so well made, challenging and fun to play, even for beginners, that pulled me right in. The first three missions (chapter 1) provide about an hours' worth of experience (hard level) and I found them very enjoyable. And let's not forget the cheeky voice-overs which are spot on and add to the experience (mother-in-law visit?).

Personally, I wasn't aware that the remaining chapters require IAPs (In App Purchases) to activate, which detracts somewhat from the whole experience. On the whole, DG2 is very enjoyable but it is so short that it just leaves a bitter aftertaste. Nevertheless, recommended to all.

review_title: Probably one of my favorite TD game.
one_reviews_text: But i feel like the game is not fair sometimes. Like for very hard bugs to crack i get very little return in money proporsional.

review_title: Best Experince of a tower defense ever !
one_reviews_text: If you stumble on my review, i'm gonna tell you right now it is the best Tower defense mode ever made and in VR it takes it to a whole other lvl . The Tower view caught me off guard i was even more blown away. Running it with 2.0 super sampling in the Debug tool and it looks MINT . GTX1080ti , 7700K 5GHZ .

When I first started this game it was fun and was doing well. The problem with this game is that when I unlock something it dosent save it I have to go throuygh the entire game to unlock the tower upgrades.
Loved this game without VR... loved it with VR too... but I really missed the grinder and supergrinder modes.  They were my favorite part, and what made the game last much longer.

review_title: Best use of Platform to Date
one_reviews_text: This is stunning.  Running on a 970 without issue.  The absolute best use of the platform I have seen so far.  For those unaware it is a (mostly) top down view of one of the best tower defense games ever made.  Well worth the money.
If you experience flickering it might be edge is open with prime video..  Close all browsers and try again.  Prime Video was my issue.
Great game with decent strategy required to do well, but relatively easy to win if even if you don't play perfectly

So gameplay great, replayablity great, and personally i love being able to hovor and look at the map from multiple diffrent angles. However oculus app wont allow me to use my oculus balance without having a paypal or credit to use for purchasing the full game. So for the time being I have to go without trying the full game which is very irratating, hope to see the payment issue resolved soon.

I must admit that I thoroughly enjoyed this game.  Was able to use my Oculus credit to purchase it but  I would have also paid the price out of pocket.  Simply put, if you enjoy playing the first chapter, go ahead and make the purchase.   It's worth it.

review_title: Great Game, Unsure How to Purchase
one_reviews_text: This is my first time trying  a DG game and I really enjoyed it. Using a GTX970 with an older driver (388.59 from  Dec 7), no Oculus Tray Tool installed,  and I have had no playability issues or stuttering. Played all the way through Chapter 1, and would love to buy the game, but am not seeing an option to purchase anywhere in game or elsewhere.

I love this game, really a good Tower Defense game.  Great graphics. I run it using super sampling = 2, it works very well ( CPU i7 + GTX1080 ).  I completed the game on every difficulty level (last one is extremely very challenging ) . Tower view was a very nice suprise. A lot of hours of fun.
Would love to play this, but the screen constantly freezes up for about 20 seconds then works for 20 then freezes etc. Waited about a month for a patch but still haven't gotten one that fixes this.
freez freez freez freez freez !!!!

I've been replaying through each level and challange mode to collect all the gold. One question; When is DG3 VR coming out? I enthusiastically recommend this title to anyone who likes and/or is even remotely interested in tower defense games.

review_title: è scontato.. ma non posso comprarlo
one_reviews_text: perchè ce l'ho in lista.. why can't buy?
Stutters with NVIDIA GTX 1080
I think this game was very fun but i have to say it was very short which i dont like because i like long strategy games

The game is pretty great, but I find the pacing fairly off in general. The pacing makes you feel like you're winging everything (which you are). The game doesn't actually allow you to observe the boardspace before the enemies approach, making any initial strategy impossible. You'll end up doing a lot of base reformatting. Since the waves come quickly, you'll only be able to make minor changes.

The other part is how they introduce new enemies. Basically every enemy has to be dealt with through trial and error. Even their own listed "counters" aren't the most efficient. Not only that, but new enemies seem to be introduced every map, and new map elements are introduced every map. I'm starting to feel a bit overwhelmed in the early stages.

Those are the main drawbacks I'm finding. The game feels so on the fly since it's impossible to just pause and actually think about what you're doing. It's kinda balanced for that, but some of the juicy placements are basically going to just be luck. There's zero chance of getting a pefect build the first time you play any map without preplanning with online spoilers.

I fell in love immediately.  I love the ability to view the action from one of the defense towers.  You can look around and explore a lot of areas with different vantage points.  It really extends the gameplay, IMHO.

I just finished beating the game and were it not for a few things it would have gotten 5 stars.  The major defect is at times your AI stops shooting at the enemy that's about to escape and goes for the one that is closer. Also your units tend to go back and forth between targets instead of focusing on one.  It would be nice if you could make both logic decisions.  It would also be great if you could inhabit whatever turret you wanted and control the weaponry!  Despite that I loved it!  I can't wait until DG3!

This game grows on you. It's not like Robo Recall or Lone Echo where you are blown away by the cool VR effects and graphics, but the more you play this game in VR the more you appreciate how awesome it is to play strategy games this way. I tried this on both the xbox and oculus, and the VR version is so much better. It's not just a simple port - this is THE way to play the game. 

You can see the entire board at once and instantly point and place towers where they need to be. It really feels like a real-life interactive game board that you get to play around with. Once I've built up all my towers it feels nice to just walk around the board and inspect the carnage. Also the replay value is incredible, I've replayed several missions already to try to get higher scores/try out different strategies. You can also play it your way - there's also a ton of options and difficulty combinations you can select to modify mission parameters and increase the replay value even further. I've checked out another game they've made Witchblade and it looks fun as well - I personally love hard/challenging games which these devs do a good job of. This and From Other Suns (different dev) have consumed the majority of my VR play time.

I've played tons of Defense Grid 1 & 2 on regular PC so naturally I had to check out the VR release. It's so well done! If you don't like Tower Defense games at all you may not enjoy this but if you even remotely enjoy that genre you owe it to yourself to check this out. The levels look fantastic, the interface is perfect and it'll suck away hours of your life (in a good way).

Overall, quality and presentation is superb in VR from the moment the game starts. I enjoyed the non-VR Defense Grid, but found myself replaying all of the levels in VR.  Its fun to goto a tower and get a view/perspective from there too. Someone saw me playing it and asked "What planet are you on?"

review_title: Excellent game, surprisingly good in VR
one_reviews_text: I knew the Defense Grid series before it came to VR, and I already enjoyed it very much. I was very skeptical about the idea of this game making it to VR, and boy was I wrong. It's actually more fun this way, and with the touch controller, much more comfortable and natural to play this way. The game in itself is a tower defense type of game, and can be enjoyed at any level of difficulty, for casual or hardcore gamers. Different gameplay modes make it nice to come back to any map, try new strategies or improve your preferred one. It's been one of my favorite VR games for quite a while now, probably the one I've played the most.

Defence Grid just works really well in the VR setting, being able to look over your battlefield whilst the waves come really adds something to the game. It helps that the game itself is a solid game anyway, so the VR can only add to a game I would have recommended even without the Rift.

Nice experience, got deep into it.
One moment drives me crazy when I try to get back to previous time point it crashes sometimes so I loose all my progress and need to start once again. Should think of keeping last time point (at least) somehow to let us continue a match after crashing the game.

VR takes the original to a whole new level. The experiencenot now more than fresh - it's now hands-on, exciting, immersive - the difference between watching someone ride a motocycle and riding one yourself. Any Command & Counquer will adore this!

For me, this is one of the best VR games I have played. Strategy/tower defence in VR. Wish more games offered a free trial, then buy to play more. How can you go wrong with that?
Challenging, but relaxing. I would buy more if offered. Silly story!
Worked great with Touch. No issues running game. Using GTX 1070.
Make more please!!

Loved Defense grid in regular mode, the VR is just icing on the cake. The models are very nicely done and watching the battle in VR is just plain fun, definitly worth at least trying for free and to me well worth purchasing.
Even with a 1080 GTX and upto date drivers. This game is utterly unplayable. I get one or two seconds of fluid play then 5 or more seconds of stutters. Too bad, I liked DG1...

review_title: Love it-How much does the upgrade cost?
one_reviews_text: Works grteat on GTX 1060 with 8th gen i5 8gb ram.   It is really fun to look around at all of the fantastic details.  Would consider buying full game but I'd like to know how much the full game costs before comitting to buy.

I own all of the previous games and they are great. Now when using Oculus Rift with Touch EVERY other games from EVERY other games studios works 100% but NOT this game. Can't get pass Menu screen because the sound and graphics "hangs". Even emailed their support with a DxDiag-file and haven't recieved any respons what so ever. So Superbad because i love this game...
review_feedback: Hi, we reached out to you via email to troubleshoot this problem. Thanks!

one_reviews_text:
Well thought gameplay with a nice hook. The story is not the best feature of the game but gives nice background chatter and the banther is sometimes funny.
Biggest misstep is the lack of variety of enemy types. Other than the basic mobs I can think of 3 different enemies: Slow tanks, fast speeders and the core-teleporting deployment pod-thingys. It doesn't utilize the full potential of VR but even with full price it's well worth it.

This game showed one thing to me: that RTS and simulations are totally possible in VR. After playing this i just want a city builder or The Settlers VR. 

From Animations to Map Design this game delivers. You're building your own modelled tower defense with tiny details everywhere. 

Plus gametime is amazing. Invested over 20 hours into it for 12 Euro. And i could still try the higher difficulty!

One of my favorite games.  Demo plays good with Samsung WMR; however, when I go to make the in-game purchase for the full game there is no button, toggle, or trackpad that will coincide with the "A" to purchase button.  The "A" button (select button) works in all other parts of the demo, just not on the purchase menu.  So I'm stuck with the demo.
review_feedback: Hi Kladoon, sorry to hear about this experience. We’ve recently learned that in-app purchases on the Oculus store aren’t currently supported on other platforms (like WMR).  We’re working to address this issue with Oculus.

one_reviews_text: Too many stutters, the game seems fine for while but then starts again to jank very often making it unplayable. I own the other versions of the game and i love it.
AMD on windows 10. At least I didnt pay for this game...
classic tower defense mechanics in a virtual world. it feels like youre standing there next to your towers, best 15 dollars ive spent so far on an oculus game

It's one of the games I play most in VR, even though it's a RTS. It can become really addicitive if you like that kind of games. It's well-made. First I thought, that the controls will be difficult to use, having to popup a menu with building options, based on another similar game I tried, where it was really slow and a disadvantage. But here it's well-made. Only thing I dislike is after I heard, that the Steam-Version has a level editor and the Oculus version doesn't, which would have been so great and is really missing. As also the pc version seems to have a multiplayer option too. Really sad, that these was left out here, otherwise I would have given 5+ stars.
unfortunately it's not playable on a gtx 1070 - stutters too much.

I've loved this game since the first one, in my top 5 tower defense games, I was surprised & very pleased to find it in VR, great job, well done, awesome, thank you :)

I only wish I could buy the full version from the store, in game purchases will not work, store purchases work fine, but you are not offering that option, I'll just check back now & then I guess :(

review_title: Best Tower Defense Game in VR
one_reviews_text: I played the original on PC. Loved the concept and the execution. Now in VR, they've definitely kicked it up a notch or two and fully immersed you in a VR version of the game. With a solid backbone of tower defense gameplay, coupled with an extended storyline as well as the icing of interactive buildings, antennae, and other objects, this game sets the bar extremely high for any other game in this genre. Great job!

I love this game on old- style monitor, and I love it in VR. Sometimes the low resolution is bothering me more in this game than with any other VR game. The dialogues between the AIs are hilarious - really well done. Hours of gaming fun with this one!

First i didn't give any attention to this title, then first levels were free to play. Tested it and liked it very much. So i bought it but then realized that there is a big disadvantage between the original pc version and VR version as well to the steam version. In ocukus version there is no level editor and in VR Version no multiplayer option. If you add these to oculus version you will recieve 5 Stars !
Its ok,

I only have one issue with the the game. when exiting it doesn't save the progress of my last playthrough. so none of my levels have the gold symbol. and none of my towers have their upgrades. as have never played the non vr version of this title. its super annoying i have to restart over again

review_title: Really addictive and easy to play
one_reviews_text: This game should be a genre for itself, the gameplay is comfortable and calming while being serious and exciting, wish I could by the whole game without in app purchases.

I didn't think I would like this type of game, but the first level was free so I tried it.  It is a simple game but quite addictive!  I finished the first level and bought the rest of the game.  This is the way games should be marketed.  I never would have bought this if they didn't give you the first level to see if you liked it first.
Game is great. But my progress in the game is not saved. I have to repeat again and again to play from the first level. This is very frustrating.
review_feedback: Hi, this sounds like a bug as progression definitely should be saved. Please email us at bugs-dg2@hiddenpath.com and we'll help you troubleshoot. One thing to check in advance is that your Windows account has proper permissions to save to the My Documents folder as this is where the savegame is stored.

one_reviews_text:
The gameplay is good. During any wave, you can zoom in and view the fight from a towers view. There's a good variety of towers to buy. Each type is good against a certain type of enemy, so mix them up. The towers can be upgraded, too. If you feel that the wrong type of tower is placed, you can sell it and make that space re-available to use.

The only real downside is the campaign story. Bad story, bad voice acting. Three AI's bickering most of the time, made the game unpleasant. I think it can be turned off in the options.

In short , good gameplay, bad story, cool effects.
review_feedback:
Hi Slick1984,
Thanks for reaching out and sorry to hear that you're encountering these freezes. Please email us at bugs-dg2@hiddenpath.com with a DXdiag report of your computer and we'll help you troubleshoot.

review_title: Missing Game Modes and no Price.
one_reviews_text:
Why no price on store?
Having to download the game and add credit card just to see price is kinda shady.
It would have got another star if the price was on the store as well.

Also missing a few game modes compared to steams version.
first chapter on steam version has 10 differnt modes to do,where vr version only has 7?
These will add up through all the chapters.
So we will end up losing tons of game modes.


Great game though i love the vr version better than the normal version.
Just a shame some missing game modes and prone to crashing at times.


btw for ppl that need to know the price it's £10.99

WOW. It looks and feels absolutely amazing beeing in the Defense Grid universe. Great graphics and great Oculus Touch support. It's so dope to experience the game in 360 3D. MUST-HAVE for TD fans! TOP TOP TOP

Absolutely love playing this game in VR. The experience of getting down on the playing field and watching the action happening all around you is amazing. The gameplay is also first rate. This game is great!
Excellent example of tower defense in VR. I love that you can get right into the action. Great storyline and voice acting as well.
Constantly freezes, cant get past load screen
review_feedback: Hi, please email us at bugs-dg2@hiddenpath.com with a description of where it's freezing along with a DXdiag report and we'll help you troubleshoot. Thanks!

one_reviews_text: This is a fantastic game.  Unbelievably fun, fast paced, good controls, and funny voice overs make it easily worth the money.  I was hooked within 30 seconds of the first map.  Being able to jump into the map is cool.  The one thing I would like is being able to take control of a tower.  I could not rate this game higher.

This game is one of the few available that allow good graphics and good gameplay to mix. Granted this game could easily be played without the Oculus but its still fun nevertheless. If you've got some loose change hanging around, I highly recomend you give this one a go.

review_title: Just like the original, but better
one_reviews_text: I played the crud out of this game long ago, and uits so cool to play it in virtual reality. This type of VR game is why I'm looking forward to brass tactics and more RTS's like this.

Well polished traditional tower defence action, enhanced by VR with decent Touch controls. I love the small-scale view that you can move around just by leaning. The gameplay is well balanced and fun. Doesn't do much beyond what you have seen in other tower defence games, but it does it all very well indeed. Easy to recommend to tower defence fans. Easy to skip if that's not your genre.

I've never really been a fan of Tower Defense games, but this one is really quite good. Dialouge in the story mode is decent, although on multiple play throughs I find myself muting them. Very comfortable playing, no nausea at all, even when dropping down to the turrent level. 

Art style is plesant to look at and it runs very smoothly on my 1060 6gb. Highly reccomend, especially at only 15 bucks for the full game.

I don't mind these games on a tablet, but I was reserved when I saw this for VR.  But heck it was free, so I thought why not.  Well I thoughly enjoyed the first chapter, and plan on buying the rest.  Even the price point for purchasing is reasonable.

- Excellent graphics
- Like the dialogs of the AI's
- Attention to detail was a bonus.  Being able to click on buildings or equipment and seeing them animate was a nice touch.
- Gameplay was fun
- Plus it was free... 'Holding up fists at developers'...Now I have to buy it. :)

Cannot start game. Nothing happens - the 'Start' button just blinks. Tried reinstalling but the problem persists.

Update: Got it to work! And it's great!
The free preview hooked me. Well worth the money to continue the game. I'm ready for more levels. Great works devs!

This game is simple.  it is blurry.  it crashed my i5 1060 several times already.  and yet, i keep coming back for more.  it is just so addicting!  I love the complex 3D mazes.  each level is more amazing than the last.  love the several difficulty options.  love the details and sounds of all the towers.  please just take all my money now.
Great Tower Defense game.
I Liked Killing The Ailiens And The Game Gets More Advanced! Good For Thinking Hard.
Great fun to play and to show others. The only things missing would be Multiplayer and an endless Mode with unlimited Waves that continuously get stronger.

I never thought I would like this sort of game but I keep coming back to it, trying to be my previouse scores. Have enjoyed playing this is so good on the CV1 and Rift S. Have recently purchased a Quest 2 and tried in there via the link cable which is also great. Just wish there was a mobile version that could be installed on the Quest itself.
review_feedback:
Hi DangerousBri,
There was a bug with some accounts that prevented the game from launching after the update. This should now be fixed.
If you are still seeing this issue, please email us at bugs-dg2@hiddenpath.com and we'll help you troubleshoot.

review_title: super nicely made game for VR
one_reviews_text:
Depending on the final prize I would like to support the team and buy the game if a release version is available. 
Currently I am running Win10, Intel 7700K and GeForce Palit 1070 without any probs. 
No freezes no crashes at all. 
Thumbs up for this game.

The free trial version is a pretty good typical tower defense game. VR is utilised a little bit by needing to search the battlefield for some things. 

Some niceish story going on with quality voice acting for this type of game. A great idea to have a free trial version and it ALMOST had me buying the full retail version but the price stopped me short of pressing the button. I think it was £10.99 for the full retail version and it is certainly worth that much, I have paid a lot more for a lot less but there is just so much competition for this game to go up against at the moment and I would rather put my pennies elsewhere. 

If it were cheaper I would have definitely bought it but then they would be underselling the game a little. 

Could be improved with some upgraded controls of the towers (fire at first/last/strongest), most utilisation of the 1st person perspective by controlling towers personally and maybe actively introducing trial players to some of the other tower types.

After 5 minutes of playing this demo, I was hooked.  It uses the Oculus Touch controllers too!  So much to love about this game, the seamless and intutitive controls, the ability to pop into a tower and view the mobs from there, the environment, the on-screen help...These devs got it right.  Everything just works and works well.  No crashes.  No errors.  It just delivers massive fun.

I liked the free levels so much I bought the game. It's fun destroying hoards of aliens and working out the stratagy of each map. I just wish the gold cubes did something and there was an `unlimted waves` option. Sometimes the waves end and your just getting into it!

Loved the game and the free trial format. It's a little bit different than the traditional tower defense game I've used. (Bloons TD 5) Another commentator used this term; 'God Mode'. An apt description in which you seemingly hover the battlefield and see your towers smash the aliens.
Just played the free to try version. So nice to have strategic games...it was missing for me. Big thanks for wide controlling methods.

I'm not a hardcore gamer by any means but this is a beautiful game, the detail when you move up close is stunning and intricate.

Comfort: Excellent. No nausea since you don't thrash around

If you want a game to show off how amazing VR can be this will certainly do it.
This Game is not playable. Low FPS, Stutters all the the time, no graphic options...

The game is fun and awesome, but it has crashed 3 out of 5 times I've sat down and played it.  Very frustrating when you've got one more wave of a tough level. Very, very rarely have I seen a crash on my Rift, so I don't think it's my setup.

review_title: I want more games like this.
one_reviews_text: I wish all games were like this.  Good game with a very nice VR touch.

Keep up the good work 

i recommend it to erveryone
Kind of wish I could move around easier though.
I just finished the free version.  I was blown away!  Looking forward in playing the full version.
I am buying it becuase I got to try it in VR. I passed up on this title many times until I got to see it in VR. Oculus can get more sales with this on other games.
I can't even get past the first setup screen in the menu. every 2-3 seconds it locks up and stutters. Roborecall, completely smooth, this can't even start.
Defense Grid in VR? Sounded like it wouldn't work, to my suprise it's a MUST BUY!
Classic Tower defense style, something I have been missing on VR! Cool battles and cool features. Like it a lot.
got to try this free first chaptor and woow  best tower game i ever played.  well be getting this next
I have sunk countless hours into this game and still enjoy it as much as when I first played it. I highly recommend this tower defence game.
cpu usage 100%, i5 6600k@4.5Ghz ,unplayable
Excellent tower defense game, now even better with touch support.
1st time playing a defense type game. Its alot of fun and just loving it!
Game is really fun, I love the miniature scale.
The game dosent even luanch its stupid
review_feedback: Hi Nickkid, Sorry to see that you are encountering these crashes. Please email us at bugs-dg2@hiddenpath.com and include a Dxdiag report of your machine and we'll help you troubleshoot.

one_reviews_text: I've purchased the Defense Grid games on Steam with all the DLC. Kind of a slap in the face to not support your customers for a VR release. I'm additionally disappointed that this is only available for the Oculus. Please support open VR, as I refuse to support this game until you support open VR.
review_feedback:
Hi Qaetan,
DG2 enhanced VR edition was a project that required a lot of additional work to bring the game into VR (it has extra game features, levels, and isn't simply a port). This was funded by Oculus, thus it being on the Oculus store. The title does have Revive support though, and if OSVR has some sort of Revive-like counterpart, it should work too. Hope this helps you understand why the VR title isn't on Steam.

one_reviews_text: I want to buy it but that is not possible with the vive right now. Only inapp purchase. come on devs....!!!!
review_feedback: DG2 VR does work with ReVive when purchased through the Oculus store.

one_reviews_text: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1BEgUSjkt44 | My favourite ALL-TIME Tower Defense game and I get to play the 'DEFINITIVE' version in glorious VR - Enough said!

Awfull awfull experience. 
FPS drops to 1-2 when moving my head, totaly unplayable! Also tends to crash, don't buy this game.
review_feedback: Hi Silonec, Sorry to see that you are running into performance issues with the game. Please email us at bugs-dg2@hiddenpath.com and include a Dxdiag report of your machine and we'll help you troubleshoot.

one_reviews_text: This game will frequently have a fatal runtime error. I think that's enough to knock off 3 stars. The game (when it works) is fun, so I'll leave the last two. There are many different kinds of towers with unlockable upgrades, etc. VR doesn't add much at all, but I honestly really wish the game would work. I tried re-installing a few times, moving the files to a path without spaces, etc. Good luck if you decide to chance it with your system.
review_feedback:
Hi thortonbe,
Sorry to see that you are encountering these crashes. Please email us at bugs-dg2@hiddenpath.com and include a Dxdiag report of your machine and we'll help you troubleshoot.

review_title: Good extension of the desktop game
one_reviews_text:
Firstly I have the desktop version and liked it so bit the bullet and bought this. I'm not sure VR adds anything to this game at all but I apreciate the additions and interaction with enviroment. Still as much fun to play.
Some negatives though I get a lot of artifcats coming in this game (looks like polygons spray out of objects on the edge of vision) playable but highly distracting at the same time.  It has also crashed on me twice. Also on larger maps there seems to be a bit of distence clipping. I preffered to get an over view of the map but the texture patterns being quite geometric and the goggle resolution means you get a lot of nosie at that scale unfortunatley - a lower grid / gun point of view is much cleaner.
Best tower defense game.

This Game is absolutley awesome. I love TD-games, but this ist the best of all. Challenging but not unfair. Whilst playing i developed some good strategies and I have lots of fun with that game. The graphic is really excelent.
Worth playing in my opinion for sure.

A fun tower defense game put into VR.  I'm not sure VR is neccessary, or even adds much beyond the token hide and seek element to gameplay... but it was well done.  One of the *full* games available for the gamepad (by virtue of adding VR on to an already successful game) you won't regret spending money on it if you enjoy tower defense type games.

review_title: Detailed Tower Defence with some VR addi
one_reviews_text:
Basic game is excellent.  It's cool to see the situation from "tower view"!  It would be good if it supported Touch controllers in some way.
( You look at things to click them. )
This might not be the best game to show off what VR can do but it's a lot of fun!
Even more emersive than the original.

I've always loved tower games but hesitated buying this...at first.  I wasn't sure what to expect but I was blown away with everything.  Ok, the 'story' is a little hokey at times, but the graphics, gameplay, upgrades, environments...all top notch!

If you like tower games even a little, you *have* to grab this game.

If I didn't know this game was released previously, I would have thought it was built from the ground up for VR.  The depth and freedom of VR offers so much to this game and the easter eggs you can hunt that are included by the dev were a hugely fun bonus.  Definitely looking forward to DG3 on Rift!
This game is fun! Easy to play with the gamepad or remote, and it's like a diorama just in front of you. This would be fun even out of VR, but being there adds a lot!

It's a tower defense game with interesting characters, easy-on-the-eyes graphics and responsive controls.  Fun to play, though nothing you couldn't find outside of VR.  Still a solid recommendation if you are trying to find something to play.

review_title: All I can say is WOW!
one_reviews_text: This tower defense game is amazing in VR. Being able to look around the whole map in vr is truly breath-taking. My favorite game in vr right now.

review_title: Brings new life to TD genre
one_reviews_text: Normally I don't particularly like Tower Defense games, and I had tried the regular PC version of DG2 and bounced off it.  But here on Oculus, I loved it.  Being able to lean around the levels, or switch to turret view, to really see what is going on yourself as opposed to the usual static screens, is fantastic.
Really adds to the typical game of Defense. You will feel like a higher power commanding things from above. Zooming in to turret view is crazy towards the end of the game.
piz make more game like this ty

review_title: Great Tower Defense Game - the reference
one_reviews_text: I played many Tower Defense Games on various devices. I do not know the PC version of this game - however, together with the VR experience this game is one of my favourites on the Oculus as of today! Please more of it - why not Plants vs. Zombies with a first person (plant) view :-)
Great fun, really addictive with top notch voice acting.
Awesome and fun game, this is may favorite game on the Rift at the moment.
It's the original game of tower defense and some plot elements with the added VR perspectives. You can see the action from a turrets POV and it's really kinda cool when the action gets going.
